messages.subject: Re: pure delight (Rainbow Poem)
messages.msgSnippet: Lemme see here. How d the math come out so strange? Abbie is 15, born in 88, january. I m thinking, we submitted the poem right after her 5th b-day, in 1993,
messages.messageBody:
Lemme see here. How'd the math come out so strange?

Abbie is 15, born in 88, january. I'm thinking, we submitted the poem
right after her 5th b-day, in 1993, but it was'nt published until the
following year. magazines are ready several months in advance of
their issue...

but if she'd been five in 94, her bday would have been 89, not 88

and your math would be closer.

I'm checking into that poetry site!thanks

HeidiC

close to

Landon was

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pure delight (Rainbow Poem)
messages.msgSnippet: That was beautiful too. I m trying to figure out how old Abigail is ( OK..poem writtin in 1994 when she was 5, that means she was born in 1989.. sooo)She is
messages.messageBody:
That was beautiful too.

I'm trying to figure out how old Abigail is ( OK..poem writtin in 1994 when
she was 5, that means she was born in 1989.. sooo)She is 13! , or close to
it. Anna is 13 too.. lol, makes the math easier for me. I think Landon was
about 13 when he discovered the Starlite Cafe web site.
(http://www.thestarlitecafe.com/) Its a poetry website where lots of writers
share their stuff.. message boards and such too. I know alot of the content
on there is "adult" (not necessarily pornographic) but written by adults.
You may want to check it out, it might be something she would enjoy.

Teresa
